alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 09 at 8:50PM EST until December 09 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 915 PM EST/815 PM CST/. * At 849 PM EST/749 PM CST/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fort Gaines, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Wire Bridge, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher, Morris, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport, Days Crossroads, and Springvale Station. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
